Diagnosis
	1. Small cell carcinoma of esophagus with liver and lung metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Etoposide Jan-Mar 2024 - 4 cycles completed
	2. Second line Topotecan commenced April 2024

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet received

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver and new bone metastases

	Current issues
	1. Worsening dysphagia
	2. Right upper quadrant pain
	3. Increasing fatigue
	4. Weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	Unfortunately [redacted name] has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Following initial response to first-line carboplatin/etoposide, recent CT on 15/5/24 shows disease progression with 30% increase in liver metastases and new bone metastases in T8 and L2 vertebrae. Despite commencing second-line topotecan four weeks ago, she reports worsening dysphagia now requiring liquid diet, new right upper quadrant pain, and increasing fatigue with ECOG PS declining from 2 to 3.

On examination today, she appears cachectic with tender hepatomegaly and reduced chest expansion. Weight has dropped from 62kg to 56kg over 6 weeks. Oxygen saturations 94% on room air.

I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and her daughter about disease progression and poor response to second-line treatment. We have agreed to discontinue topotecan given lack of benefit and declining performance status.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent MRI spine to assess bone metastases
	2. Speech and language therapy assessment for dysphagia

	Medication prescribed
	1. Increased dexamethasone to 4mg bd
	2. Commenced oxycodone MR 10mg bd
	3. Continued lansoprazole 30mg od

	Follow up
	1. Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	2. Oncology review in 1 week
	3. District nurse referral completed

	Required GP actions
	1. Please monitor pain control
	2. Consider prophylactic antibiotics if neutropenic
	3. Support palliative care involvement
